intro: Castanopsis yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan stone栎, is a deciduous broadleaf tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that enclose one or two seeds, typical of the genus Castanopsis. It thrives in temperate to subtropical climates and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
